metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26961 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
When DNS over HTTPS is in use, it intentionally filters RFC1918 and relatedIP ranges from the responses as these do not make sense coming from a DoHresolver. However when an IPv4 address was mapped through IPv6, theseaddresses were erroneously let through, leading to a potential DNSRebinding attack. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83, Firefox ESR <78.5, and Thunderbird < 78.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26961` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
